awd_titl_txt: Equipment for Rockmagnetic and Paleomagnetic Research:      Squid Magnetometer and Shielded Room
awd_abstract_narration: This award provides one-half the funding needed to acquire a               cryogenic magnetometer and to construct a magnetically shielded                 room in which to operate it. The magnetometer will be installed and             operated in the Department of Geology and Geophysics at the                     University of Utah. The University of Utah is committed to                      providing the remaining funds necessary for this project.                            The equipment will be used primarily in the research projects              of the Principal Investigator, which are aimed at explaining the                origins and meaning of rock magnetism. The high-sensitivity                     magnetometer will make it possible to measure magnetic moments of               individual mineral particles in magnetized rocks and to study the               development of magnetic remanence in rocks under conditions that                mimic natural settings.
